page.title: 01Newbold Church Schools
page.content: The first Church School was founded by George Milnes Esq. of Dunston Hall, assisted by voluntary contributions. A site was chosen on the western edge of the Little Moor and a local farmer, George Roberts, became the first master when it opened in 1785 with eight pupils. In 1844 the upper room was used as a class for girls only and owing to a gradual rise in numbers the school was sold in 1863 and became the Wheatsheaf Inn, the second School being built near to the new Anglican Church opening in July 1863. It gave good service to the community for 98 years despite epidemics of measles, whooping cough, scarlet fever, small- pox and typhoid. It was closed in 1961 & re-opened in 1965 as the Eagle Club. The third Church School opened in Oct 1961 with additional building in 1979. In 1985 the roll is 189 in seven rooms
